credentials.name: CQLSH_KEYSPACE
credentials.description: The keyspace target

credentials.name: CQLSH_HOST
credentials.description: The host of the Cassandra cluster

credentials.name: CQLSH_PORT
credentials.description: The port of the Cassandra cluster. Defaults to 9042

credentials.name: CQLSH_USER
credentials.description: The user can connect in the Cassandra cluster.

credentials.name: CQLSH_PASSWD
credentials.description: The password to connect in the Cassandra cluster.

connections.name: Apache Cassandra
connections.description: A highly scalable, distributed NoSQL database designed for handling large amounts of data across many servers.

overview.description: Access your Cassandra clusters securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive audit trails, AI-powered data masking for sensitive information, and granular access controls. Execute CQL queries with confidence knowing all interactions are monitored and protected.

credentials.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
credentials.description: The access key credential

credentials.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
credentials.description: The secret key credential

credentials.name: AWS_REGION
credentials.description: The AWS region

connections.name: AWS CLI

requirements.description: Use an IAM credential with reduced scope to only create secrets and/or listing ECS services.

connections.description: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services from the command line.

overview.description: Access your AWS resources securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive command auditing, intelligent cost monitoring, and automated credential management. Execute AWS CLI commands with built-in compliance tracking and session recording for complete infrastructure governance.

connections.name: AWS CloudWatch
connections.description: A monitoring and observability service that provides data and actionable insights for AWS, hybrid, and on-premises applications and infrastructure resources.

overview.description: Access AWS CloudWatch logs securely through Hoop.dev with intelligent log analysis, automated data classification, and comprehensive audit trails. Monitor your AWS infrastructure with built-in cost controls and session recording for complete observability governance.

requirements.description: The AWS credentials require the minimal set of IAM permissions to work:

credentials.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
credentials.description: The AWS access key ID for CloudWatch Logs access

credentials.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
credentials.description: The AWS secret access key for CloudWatch Logs access

credentials.name: AWS_REGION
credentials.description: The AWS region where your CloudWatch log groups are located (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1)

connections.name: AWS ECS
connections.description: Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) is a fully managed container orchestration service that helps you easily deploy, manage, and scale containerized applications.

overview.description: Execute commands in your ECS containers securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive session recording, intelligent resource monitoring, and automated access controls. Run one-off tasks and debug containerized applications with complete audit trails and built-in security guardrails.

requirements.description: This connection uses a wrapper script available in the hoophq/hoopdev image called ecs-exec.sh. This script requires the following permissions to work:

credentials.name: CLUSTER_NAME
credentials.description: The name or arn of the ECS Cluster

credentials.name: SERVICE_NAME
credentials.description: The name of the service on ECS

credentials.name: CONTAINER
credentials.description: The name of the container defaults to the first one.

credentials.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
credentials.description: The access key credential

credentials.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
credentials.description: The secret key credential

credentials.name: AWS_DEFAULT_REGION
credentials.description: The AWS region

connections.name: BigQuery
connections.description: A fully managed, serverless data warehouse that enables super-fast SQL queries using Google's infrastructure.

requirements.description: The Google Service Account Credentials must have the following permissions:

overview.description: Connect to BigQuery through Hoop.dev for secure analytics access with automated data classification, query monitoring, and intelligent cost controls. Execute petabyte-scale queries while protecting sensitive datasets with zero-config data masking.

credentials.name: GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS
credentials.description: The service account credentials file in JSON format

credentials.name: CLOUDSDK_CORE_PROJECT
credentials.description: The project id to use for request

connections.name: Clojure
connections.description: A dynamic, general-purpose programming language that combines interactive development with efficient infrastructure for multithreaded programming.

overview.description: Access your Clojure REPL environments securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive session recording, intelligent code execution monitoring, and automated dependency management. Execute Clojure expressions with built-in safeguards, audit trails, and seamless JVM integration.

connections.name: Django

connections.description: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability.

requirements.description: The AWS credentials require the minimal set of IAM permissions to work

overview.description: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability.

credentials.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID

Execute Elixir code with built-in concurrency safeguards and complete audit trails for distributed systems development.

connections.name: HTTP Proxy
connections.description: Access HTTP/HTTPS endpoints securely through Hoop.dev with intelligent traffic monitoring, automated request/response logging, and comprehensive access controls.

Proxy HTTP connections with built-in data masking, session recording, and advanced security guardrails for complete API governance.

credentials.name: REMOTE_URL
credentials.description: The target HTTP/HTTPS URL to proxy requests to

connections.name: Kubernetes Cluster Administration
connections.description: Administer your Kubernetes cluster through kubectl commands with comprehensive audit trails and session recording.

overview.description: Manage your Kubernetes clusters securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive kubectl command auditing, RBAC-integrated access controls, and intelligent namespace protection. Execute cluster administration operations with complete session recording and built-in security guardrails.

credentials.name: KUBECONFIG
credentials.description: A [Kubeconfig File](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/) with permission to access the cluster

connections.name: Kubernetes Container Commands
connections.description: Execute one-off commands inside Kubernetes containers with comprehensive logging and audit trails.

overview.description: Execute commands inside your Kubernetes containers securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive session recording, intelligent command monitoring, and automated access controls. Run one-off tasks and debug containerized applications with complete audit trails.

credentials.name: KUBECONFIG
credentials.description: A [Kubeconfig File](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/) with permission to access the cluster

credentials.name: KUBERNETES_RESOURCE
credentials.description: The Kubernetes resource to target for executing commands (e.g., deployment/myapp, pod/mypod, statefulset/myapp)

connections.name: Kubernetes Interactive Access
connections.description: Open interactive shell sessions inside Kubernetes containers with full TTY support and session recording.

overview.description: Access your Kubernetes containers interactively through Hoop.dev with full TTY support, comprehensive session recording, and intelligent access controls. Open shell sessions for debugging, development, and administrative tasks with complete audit trails.

credentials.name: KUBECONFIG
credentials.description: A [Kubeconfig File](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/) with permission to access the cluster

credentials.name: KUBERNETES_RESOURCE
credentials.description: The Kubernetes resource to target for interactive access (e.g., deployment/myapp, pod/mypod, statefulset/myapp)

connections.name: Microsoft SQL Server
connections.description: A relational database management system developed by Microsoft, offering comprehensive data management and business intelligence capabilities.

overview.description: Connect to your SQL Server databases through Hoop.dev with enterprise-grade security, automated compliance logging, and real-time data protection. Execute T-SQL queries with advanced access controls and intelligent masking of sensitive business data.

credentials.name: HOST
credentials.description: The IP or Host of the SQL Server

credentials.name: USER
credentials.description: The user with access to the instance

credentials.name: PASS
credentials.description: The password with access to the instance

credentials.name: PORT
credentials.description: The port of the SQL server

credentials.name: DB
credentials.description: The name of the database to connect (Required when using the connection via the command line).

credentials.name: INSECURE
credentials.description: If the connection will ignore the chain of certificates presented by the server. The connection will be subject to man-in-the-middle attacks if the network is not reliable. By default, this option is set to false.

connections.name: MongoDB
connections.description: A NoSQL document-oriented database that provides high scalability and flexibility for modern applications.

overview.description: Connect to your MongoDB instances through Hoop.dev's secure access gateway with automated data protection, comprehensive query auditing, and intelligent access controls. Execute database operations with real-time masking of sensitive document fields.

credentials.name: CONNECTION_STRING
credentials.description: The MongoDB connection string. See [MongoDB connection string](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/connection-string/) for more details about the proper format.

connections.name: MySQL
connections.description: The world's most popular open-source relational database, offering proven performance, reliability, and ease-of-use.

overview.description: Access your MySQL databases securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive audit logging, real-time data protection, and streamlined access management. Execute queries with built-in guardrails that prevent risky operations while maintaining developer productivity.

credentials.name: HOST
credentials.description: The IP or Host of the MySQL server

credentials.name: USER
credentials.description: The user to connect in the MySQL server

credentials.name: PASS
credentials.description: The password to connect to the MySQL server

credentials.name: PORT
credentials.description: The port of the MySQL server

credentials.name: DB
credentials.description: The name of the database to connect (Required when using the connection via the command line).

credentials.name: PRE_SQL_SCRIPT_FILE
credentials.description: Append a custom SQL script at the beginning of the execution.

connections.name: Node.js
connections.description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, enabling server-side JavaScript development with high performance.

overview.description: Access your Node.js development environments securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive session recording, intelligent script execution monitoring, and automated secret management. Execute JavaScript code and manage npm packages with built-in safeguards and audit trails.

connections.name: Oracle
connections.description: A multi-model database management system designed for enterprise grid computing and high-performance applications.

overview.description: Access your Oracle databases through Hoop.dev with enterprise-level security and compliance features, comprehensive audit trails, and automated data protection. Execute SQL operations with granular access controls and intelligent masking for sensitive enterprise data.

credentials.name: HOST
credentials.description: The IP or Host of the Oracle server

credentials.name: USER
credentials.description: The user to connect in the Oracle server

credentials.name: PASS
credentials.description: The password to connect to the Oracle server. Make sure to URL encode the password if it contains any special characters.

credentials.name: PORT
credentials.description: The port of the Oracle server

credentials.name: LD_LIBRARY_PATH
credentials.description: Oracle client library path

credentials.name: SID
credentials.description: The service name or SID (System identifier) to identify the database service.

connections.name: PHP Artisan
connections.description: Laravel Artisan is the command-line interface included with Laravel, providing helpful commands for application development.

overview.description: Access your Laravel Artisan console securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive command monitoring, database migration tracking, and intelligent access controls. Execute PHP artisan commands with complete audit logging and built-in security guardrails.

connections.name: PostgreSQL
connections.description: A powerful, open-source relational database system known for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.

overview.description: Connect to your PostgreSQL databases through Hoop.dev's secure gateway with zero-config AI data masking, comprehensive session recording, and intelligent access controls. Execute SQL queries while automatically protecting sensitive data like PII and credentials without complex rule setup.

credentials.name: HOST
credentials.description: The IP or hostname of the PostgreSQL server

credentials.name: USER
credentials.description: The username to connect to PostgreSQL

credentials.name: PASS
credentials.description: The password to connect to the Postgres server. Make sure to URL encode the password if it contains any special characters.

credentials.name: PORT
credentials.description: The port of the Postgres server

credentials.name: DB
credentials.description: The name of the database to connect (Required when using the connection via the command line).

credentials.name: SSLMODE
credentials.description: How to connect via tls with the remote host, it defaults to prefer. See [PostgreSQL SSL documentation](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-ssl.html#LIBPQ-SSL-PROTECTION) for more information. Available options are disable, prefer, require, and verify-full

connections.name: Python Scripts
connections.description: A versatile, high-level programming language perfect for scripting, automation, data analysis, and application development.

overview.description: Execute Python scripts securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive logging, automated dependency management, and intelligent code execution controls. Run data analysis, automation tasks, and development workflows with built-in security guardrails and session recording.

connections.name: Redis
connections.description: An in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker with support for various data types.

overview.description: Access your Redis instances securely through Hoop.dev with high-performance connection management, session recording, and intelligent data protection. Execute Redis commands with built-in safeguards and comprehensive audit trails for cache operations and data queries.

credentials.name: HOST
credentials.description: The host of the Redis server

credentials.name: PORT
credentials.description: The port of the Redis server

credentials.name: USER
credentials.description: The username for Redis authentication (Redis 6.0+)

credentials.name: PASSWORD
credentials.description: The password for Redis authentication

credentials.name: DB_NUMBER
credentials.description: The database number to select (0-15)

connections.name: Ruby on Rails
connections.description: A web application framework written in Ruby that follows the MVC pattern, providing tools for rapid web development.

overview.description: Access your Rails console securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive audit logging, automated secret management, and intelligent access controls. Execute Rails commands and interact with your application models with full session recording and data protection.

credentials.name: HOST
credentials.description: The IP or hostname of the SSH server

credentials.name: PORT
credentials.description: The port of the SSH server, default to 22

credentials.name: USER
credentials.description: The username of the Linux server

credentials.name: PASS
credentials.description: The credentials of the username if password authentication is enabled in the SSH server.

credentials.name: AUTHORIZED_SERVER_KEYS
credentials.description: The private key of the user that corresponds to the public key at $HOME/<user>/.ssh/authorized_keys

connections.name: Secure Shell (SSH)
connections.description: A cryptographic network protocol for operating network services securely over an unsecured network, commonly used for remote command-line login.

overview.description: Access your servers securely through Hoop.dev with comprehensive SSH session recording, intelligent command monitoring, and automated access controls. Connect to remote hosts with complete audit trails, data masking capabilities, and built-in security guardrails that eliminate the need for traditional VPN access.

connections.name: Web Applications and APIs
connections.description: Web applications and APIs that provide HTTP/HTTPS endpoints for various services, applications, and data access interfaces.

overview.description: Access your web applications and APIs securely through Hoop.dev with intelligent traffic monitoring, automated request/response logging, and comprehensive access controls. Tunnel HTTP/HTTPS connections with built-in data masking and session recording for complete API governance.

credentials.name: HOST
credentials.description: The IP or hostname of the service

credentials.name: PORT
credentials.description: The port of the service
